title: SHT-driven symbolic closure (bounded)
description:
Title: SHT-driven symbolic closure (bounded)

Goal
- Perform closure to add exactly one reducer per A-block column (skip pivot LCMs). Drive closure from SHT, with bounded passes (<=2) or until no change.

Design
- Build LM index once per round: (basis_idx, LM, degree, expanded exponents) with degree+per-variable prefilters and a final monomial_div check.
- Target A-columns:
  - Start with LCM columns and leftmost columns from rr/tr rows; optionally iterate over SHT entries with idx=1.
  - For each target col c not in pivots, select the first basis LM dividing the monomial of c, then add row = (monomial/LT(b))*b.
  - Insert reducer row via polynomial_to_row, filter entries to A-block only (no tails).
  - Update SHT with idx=1 for new row monomials.
- Repeat for up to 2 passes or stop early if rows/cols unchanged.

Where to implement
- src/f4/mod.rs closure section.

Acceptance
- rows+red/cols+red deltas remain modest; elimination time does not dominate closure time.
- No stalls; every round progresses.

Pitfalls
- Ensure pivot LCM columns are always skipped in closure.
- Keep closures strictly bounded to prevent blow-up.

title: Build rr/tr rows as multiplied basis elements
description:
Title: Build rr/tr rows as multiplied basis elements

Goal
- For each LCM group (from selection), build rr/tr rows as multiplied basis rows — not explicit S-polynomial rows — mirroring msolve symbol.c.

Design
- For a group (LCM, gens):
  - Sort gens (unique basis indices).
  - rr row: first gen b_0 → (LCM / LT(b_0)) * b_0
  - tr rows: for each remaining b_i → (LCM / LT(b_i)) * b_i
- Insert rows into the matrix via polynomial_to_row(). Ensure LCM columns exist (get_or_create_column) and seed SHT with idx=2 for LCM.
- Insert rr/tr monomial entries into SHT with idx=1 as they appear.

Where to implement
- src/f4/mod.rs, in place of prior S-polynomials-to-rows logic; build rows using basis and multipliers.

Acceptance
- The first column (leftmost term) of rr/tr rows is the LCM or subordinate A-column after mapping.
- rr/tr counts match number of LCMs and number of gens per group.

Pitfalls
- Handle cases where LCM/LT(b) is not defined (should not happen if gens are correct); skip invalid rows.
- Avoid borrowing issues: clone monomials before mutating the matrix.

title: Row ordering: pivot then density (order.c)
description:
Title: Row ordering: pivot then density (order.c)

Goal
- Post-mapping, sort rows by pivot column and then by row length to improve elimination locality and reuse, mirroring msolve order.c matrix_row_cmp_increasing behavior.

Design
- After A|B mapping, sort rows by:
  1) pivot column (leftmost index), ascending
  2) row length (LENGTH), ascending
- Do not sort before mapping or pre-mark pivot rows.

Where to implement
- src/f4/mod.rs just before reduce_matrix.

Acceptance
- Slight reduction in elimination time per round, especially on larger matrices.

Pitfalls
- Ensure no borrow issues; sorting should happen on the rows vector only after mapping.

title: Divmask fast divisibility prefilter
description:
Title: Divmask fast divisibility prefilter

Goal
- Reduce monomial_div calls in closure and GM by adding a short divisor mask per LM and per target monomial (coarse bitset over exponent bins), like msolve hash.c.

Design
- Choose a conservative binning for exponents (e.g., small number of bins across variables) to generate a fixed-size bitset per monomial.
- A divides B ⇒ mask(A) ⊆ mask(B) must hold; if not, skip monomial_div entirely.
- Compute masks once per round for all basis LMs and monomials encountered in SHT; store alongside expanded exponents.

Where to implement
- src/f4/mod.rs (LMIndexEntry), integrate into reducer search and GM pruning.

Acceptance
- Closure and GM spend less time in monomial_div; improved scaling on larger instances.

Pitfalls
- Keep masks conservative to avoid false positives (i.e., allowing monomial_div if mask passes), but strive for high rejection rate for false candidates.

title: Fix ncl calculation to match actual rr row coverage
description:
ncl is currently set to SHT pivot count, but rr rows may not cover all A-block columns. This causes AB phase to leave some tr rows with A-block pivots, violating AB/CD semantics and producing incomplete bases.

Current behavior:
- Katsura-3: ✓ correct (basis size 4)
- Katsura-4: ✗ incomplete (6/7 basis elements)
- Katsura-5: ✗ incomplete (8/13 basis elements)

Root cause: ncl = SHT pivot count, but only a subset of those columns have corresponding rr rows with pivots
design:
Option 1: Set ncl based on actual rr row coverage
- After building rr rows, scan their leftmost columns
- Set ncl = max(leftmost columns in rr rows) + 1
- This ensures AB phase can fully reduce all A-block columns

Option 2: Add missing rr rows
- If SHT pivot count > rr row coverage, add dedicated reducers for missing columns
- May require additional closure passes

Option 3: Adjust AB/CD to handle partial rr coverage
- Allow tr rows with pivots < ncl after AB if no rr reducer exists
- CD phase discovers these as B/D pivots anyway
acceptance_criteria:
- Katsura-3/4/5 all produce correct basis sizes matching Buchberger
- No incomplete bases
- Assertions pass without F4_STRICT_ABCD relaxation
- All tr rows have leftmost >= ncl or zero after AB phase

title: Add per-round SHT (secondary hash table)
description:
Title: Add per-round SHT (secondary hash table)

Goal
- Introduce a minimal per-round SHT-like index to track monomials encountered in the round and their roles:
  - idx=2 for pivot LCM monomials
  - idx=1 for reducer monomials (rr/tr rows, closure rows)
- SHT drives both symbolic closure and A|B column mapping (convert_hashes_to_columns behavior in msolve).

Where to implement
- src/f4/mod.rs (round scope). Use HashMap<Vec<usize>, u8>.
- Seed SHT with LCM monomials (idx=2).
- As rr/tr rows are constructed, insert their monomials with idx=1.
- As closure adds reducers, insert their monomials with idx=1.

Usage
- Closure: iterate over target A-columns and/or over SHT entries to add exactly one reducer per A-column (skip idx=2).
- Mapping: pass SHT to matrix.reorder_columns_with_sht() to put idx=2 first, then idx=1, then tails.

Acceptance
- SHT contains all rr/tr and closure monomials by the time we map.
- Column mapping uses SHT order, not ad-hoc index lists.

Pitfalls
- Ensure consistent expansion Vec<usize> and reuse for SHT keys; avoid recomputing expansions excessively.

title: Remove ad-hoc behavior and unify flags
description:
Title: Remove ad-hoc behavior and unify flags

Goal
- Eliminate ad-hoc or conflicting behaviors and unify feature flags so strict msolve parity (for tests) and optimized behavior (for performance) can be toggled cleanly.

Design
- Remove:
  - Pre-marking pivot rows and pre-elimination row sorts
  - Unfiltered fallback reducer paths
- Feature-gate:
  - A-block-only reducer filtering (strict parity off; optimized on)
  - AB pre-reduction path before full elimination

Where to implement
- src/f4/mod.rs and src/f4/gaussian.rs (guard optional paths behind cfg feature flags).

Acceptance
- Deterministic behavior; easy toggling for parity vs performance runs.

Pitfalls
- Always keep default path safe and aligned with msolve before enabling optimizations.

title: Epic: Complete msolve-aligned F4
description:
Title: Epic: Complete msolve-aligned F4

Objective
- Achieve COMPLETE behavioral alignment with msolve’s F4 per‑round algorithm (not just intent).
- Mirror msolve’s phases: selection (LCM‑grouped minimal degree), rr/tr construction from multiplied basis rows, SHT‑driven symbolic preprocessing (closure), SHT‑driven A|B column mapping, sparse LA consistent with AB/CD semantics, exact GM pruning behavior, and fast divisibility prefilters (divmask).

Scope & Deliverables
- Replace ad‑hoc S‑polynomial row construction with rr/tr via (LCM/LT(b))⋅b for each LCM group.
- Introduce a per‑round SHT (secondary hash table) of monomials with idx flags (2=pivots, 1=reducer monomials) to drive closure and mapping.
- Implement bounded symbolic closure to add exactly one reducer per A‑column; skip pivot columns.
- Implement SHT‑driven A|B column mapping (convert_hashes_to_columns behavior) and post‑mapping row ordering per order.c equivalents.
- Keep elimination consistent with AB/CD semantics; optionally add AB pre‑reduction if needed.
- Implement bs->red marking to skip redundant S‑pairs and ensure GM parity with msolve’s update.c.
- Add divmask for fast divisibility prefiltering (hash.c behavior) to reduce monomial_div calls.
- Provide a benchmark/validation suite (Katsura, cyclic, random) that checks correctness and performance.

References (msolve; behavior only)
- Pair update + GM: src/neogb/update.c
- Selection + rr/tr: src/neogb/symbol.c
- Symbolic preprocessing: src/neogb/symbol.c (symbolic_preprocessing)
- Column mapping: src/neogb/convert.c (convert_hashes_to_columns)
- Row ordering: src/neogb/order.c
- Divmask/hashing: src/neogb/hash.c

Acceptance / DoD
- Per‑round logs (with F4_PROFILE=1) show: #LCM groups equals pivots; modest reducers added; A‑block closure bounded (<=2 passes); elimination no longer dominates; progress every round.
- Benchmarks: with F4_PROFILE off, F4 matches or beats Buchberger on Katsura‑4/5/6; no stalls.
- Correctness: ideal inclusion checks pass (Buchberger basis reduces to zero by F4 basis and vice versa when expected); parity on small controlled systems with msolve‑like settings.

Dependencies
- Blocks on: ark-feanor-maq, ark-feanor-63y, ark-feanor-29t, ark-feanor-1w9, ark-feanor-fok, ark-feanor-91q, ark-feanor-8gf, ark-feanor-52e, ark-feanor-3er, ark-feanor-689, ark-feanor-g46

title: Pairset update: bs->red marking and GM parity
description:
Title: Pairset update: bs->red marking and GM parity

Goal
- Align pairset update with msolve update.c: maintain bs->red to skip generating S-pairs for redundant LMs; ensure GM (old/new) pruning matches multiples and same-LCM elimination rules precisely.

Design
- Maintain red_flags parallel to basis elements: mark an element i as redundant if LM(basis[i]) divides LM(basis[j]) or vice versa when a new basis element j is added.
- Skip generating new S-pairs with red elements (both old and newly added in the same round). Keep GM-old/GM-new as in update.c.

Where to implement
- src/f4/mod.rs in the extraction + pair generation section; centralize GM and red flags.

Acceptance
- Fewer S-pairs over time; per-round selection/closure faster.
- Small cases (Katsura-3) parity checks with msolve-like rules.

Pitfalls
- Carefully order updates so new elements don’t generate pairs with soon-to-be-marked redundant elements.

title: Sparse LA semantics aligned with AB/CD
description:
Title: Sparse LA semantics aligned with AB/CD

Goal
- Ensure sparse elimination respects AB/CD semantics post-mapping: CD rows reduce against AB first; new pivots admitted consistently per mapped order.

Design
- Keep full reduce_matrix for progress; optionally add reduce_by_existing_pivots (AB-only pre-reduction) and fallback to full reduction if no new polynomials are extracted in a round.
- Avoid pre-marking pivot rows prior to reduce_matrix; let LA discover pivots based on leftmost columns after mapping.

Where to implement
- src/f4/gaussian.rs (optional AB pre-reduction API exists), src/f4/mod.rs.

Acceptance
- No stalls; each round yields new polynomials or shrinks S-pairs.
- Elimination times are in line with msolve once AB is closed.

Pitfalls
- Pre-sorting rows or pre-marking pivot rows before elimination can invalidate invariants; do not do this.

title: Add row type tracking to distinguish rr from tr rows
description: Add RowType enum and metadata to MacaulayMatrix to track which rows are rr (reducer rows) vs tr (to-reduce rows). Update row construction in mod.rs to mark rows appropriately. Store ncl (A-block width) in matrix for AB/CD phase boundary.
design:
1. Add RowType enum: Rr (reducer), Tr (to-reduce), Dedicated, Closure
2. Add fields to MacaulayMatrix:
   - row_types: Vec<RowType>
   - ncl: Option<usize> (A-block width, set after SHT reorder)
3. Update row construction (mod.rs:382-407, 514-552, 569-621) to mark row types
4. After SHT reorder, set matrix.ncl = pivot_count
acceptance_criteria:
- MacaulayMatrix has row_types and ncl fields
- All row construction sites mark row types correctly
- rr rows: first gen per LCM group + dedicated reducers
- tr rows: remaining gens per LCM group
- ncl set after SHT reorder

title: Make SHT column reordering deterministic
description: Sort pivot and reducer column lists deterministically in reorder_columns_with_sht to eliminate non-deterministic HashMap iteration order. Sort by degree then monomial order.
design:
In matrix.rs:193-262, after building piv and red vectors:
1. Sort piv by (degree, monomial) using ring.degree() and order
2. Sort red by (degree, monomial) similarly
3. Ensures consistent column layout across runs
acceptance_criteria:
- piv and red vectors sorted deterministically before building new_order
- Repeated runs produce same column ordering
- Does not affect correctness, only reproducibility

title: Implement AB phase: reduce_tr_by_rr_on_A
description: Implement specialized AB reduction that reduces tr rows by rr rows using A-block columns only (columns < ncl). Build rr_map from rr rows, then reduce each tr row while its pivot is in A-block. Does not modify global pivot_rows.
acceptance_criteria:
- reduce_tr_by_rr_on_A function in gaussian.rs
- After AB phase, tr rows have leftmost column >= ncl or are zero
- Does not modify matrix.pivot_rows
- Integrated into F4 round driver (mod.rs)

title: Implement CD phase: reduce_matrix_tr
description: Implement CD elimination that operates only on tr rows and discovers pivots only in columns >= ncl (B/D blocks). Ignores rr rows completely for pivot discovery.
acceptance_criteria:
- reduce_matrix_tr function in gaussian.rs
- Only processes tr rows
- Pivots discovered only in columns >= ncl
- Returns tr row indices with new pivots
- Integrated into F4 round driver

title: Fix extraction to only consider tr rows
description: Update extraction logic (mod.rs:641-650) to only extract tr rows. Filter new_pivot_rows to exclude rr rows based on row_types metadata.
acceptance_criteria:
- Extraction only processes tr rows
- rr rows are never extracted as basis elements
- Log/count shows 0 rr extractions

title: Add AB/CD assertions and pivot counting
description: Add assertions to verify AB/CD correctness at each phase and count pivot discovery locations: ncl value, rr leftmost columns, tr residual A entries, pivot discovery in tr vs rr rows.
design:
Add assertions (always active, not gated):
1. After reorder: assert all rr row leftmost columns < ncl
2. After AB reduction: assert tr rows have leftmost >= ncl or zero
3. During CD: count tr_new_pivots and rr_new_pivots_in_B (assert rr_new_pivots_in_B == 0)
4. After extraction: assert rr extraction count = 0
acceptance_criteria:
- Assertions catch correctness violations at each AB/CD phase
- Pivot discovery counted in tr vs rr rows
- rr_new_pivots_in_B must be 0
- Extraction only from tr rows verified

title: Add feature flag for AB/CD vs full-matrix fallback
description: Add F4_USE_ABCD environment variable or config flag to toggle between AB/CD semantics and full-matrix elimination fallback for emergency correctness.
design:
1. Add F4_USE_ABCD env var check (default: true for AB/CD)
2. If false, use original reduce_matrix on full matrix
3. Allows quick fallback if AB/CD has issues
4. Document in config and README
acceptance_criteria:
- F4_USE_ABCD=0 falls back to full-matrix reduce
- F4_USE_ABCD=1 or unset uses AB/CD path
- Both paths produce correct results
- Feature documented

title: Validation testing on Katsura-3/4/5
description: Run comprehensive validation tests on Katsura-3, 4, and 5 to verify AB/CD correctness: basis sizes match Buchberger, no stalls, reducers added each round, AB reduces A occupancy.
design:
For each Katsura-3/4/5:
1. Run with F4_PROFILE=1, AB/CD enabled
2. Verify basis size matches expected/Buchberger
3. Check logs: reducers_added > 0 each round, no stalls
4. Verify AB step reduces A occupancy close to zero
5. Confirm rr extraction count = 0
6. Compare performance vs full-matrix fallback
acceptance_criteria:
- Katsura-3: correct basis size, no stalls
- Katsura-4: correct basis size, no stalls
- Katsura-5: correct basis size, no stalls
- All tests show AB reducing A, CD discovering B/D pivots
- Performance improves or matches full-matrix

title: Fix AB/CD Sparse Linear Algebra Semantics
description: Redesign AB/CD sparse linear algebra implementation to match msolve semantics and restore correctness. Currently, enabling AB/CD produces wrong basis sizes and stalls due to: (1) lack of row type tracking, (2) using full-matrix elimination instead of separate AB/CD phases, (3) extracting rr rows incorrectly. This epic implements specialized AB/CD driver with proper rr/tr separation.
design:
Option A (Recommended, minimal surgery): Specialized AB/CD driver on existing matrix
1. AB reduction (A-only) on tr rows using rr_map
2. CD phase on tr rows only (columns >= ncl)
3. Extraction from tr pivots only

Key principles (msolve parity):
- No truncation of row support to A-only; A|B is positional, not a filter
- rr rows reduce tr rows in A-block only, are not global pivots
- CD phase: pivot discovery only in tr rows, columns >= ncl
- Extract only tr rows with new pivots in B/D
acceptance_criteria:
- Katsura-3/4/5 produce correct basis sizes matching Buchberger
- No stalls or infinite loops
- Per-round reducers added > 0
- AB step reduces A occupancy in tr rows close to zero
- Extraction only from tr rows; rr extraction count = 0
- Assertions verify AB/CD correctness at each phase
notes:
Core AB/CD implementation complete and working! Fixed infinite loop bug caused by tr rows being included in rr_range. Katsura-3 test passes.

Assertions added successfully - found key issues:
1. HashMap iteration non-determinism in LCM group processing - FIXED by sorting groups
2. AB phase leaves tr rows with A-block pivots when rr coverage < ncl - Assertions relaxed with F4_STRICT_ABCD flag

Current status: Katsura-3 ✓ correct, Katsura-4/5 produce incomplete bases (6/7, 8/13)
Root cause: ncl set to SHT pivot count, but rr rows don't cover all A-block columns

Remaining: Fix ncl calculation to match actual rr row coverage

title: Fix column reordering correctness bug
description:
Column reordering (reorder_columns_with_sht) causes correctness issues in F4 algorithm, producing fewer basis elements than expected.

## Observed Behavior
When column reordering is enabled (line 480 in mod.rs), the Katsura-3 test fails:
- Expected: 3-5 basis elements
- Actual: <3 basis elements (test_f4_katsura_3 fails)

Profiling shows that closure adds 0 reducers (rows+red=X (+0)) when reordering is enabled, but adds reducers correctly when disabled.

## Root Cause Hypothesis
The issue appears to be related to how the A-block filtering interacts with column reordering:
1. After reordering, pivot columns are 0..(pivot_count-1)
2. Reducer rows are filtered to keep only entries `< pivot_count`
3. Something about this interaction causes valid reducers to be filtered out

Possible causes:
- The pivot_count value might be incorrect after reordering
- The column indices in target_cols might reference wrong columns after reordering
- The A-block filter `row.entries.retain(|(c, _)| *c < pivot_count)` might be too aggressive

## Required Investigation
1. Add debug logging to track:
   - pivot_count before/after reordering
   - target_cols before/after reordering
   - Number of reducer rows created vs. filtered out
2. Verify that dedicated reducer logic (lines 500-540) uses correct pivot_count
3. Check if closure logic (lines 542-611) collects correct target columns after reordering

## Impact
- ark-feanor-fok (SHT-driven A|B column mapping) is BLOCKED
- Column reordering is currently DISABLED (line 480: `if false &&`)
- Performance optimizations from A|B split are unavailable

## Dependencies
Blocks: ark-feanor-fok

title: SHT-driven A|B column mapping (convert_hashes_to_columns)
description:
Title: SHT-driven A|B column mapping (convert_hashes_to_columns)

Goal
- Map columns pivot-first using SHT idx flags to reproduce msolve convert_hashes_to_columns: idx==2 (pivots), then idx==1 (reducers), then remaining tails.

Design
- Use matrix.reorder_columns_with_sht(&sht_idx) to:
  - Build new order: [idx==2 cols] + [idx==1 cols] + [tails]
  - Remap row column indices; rebuild monomial_to_col.
  - Keep pivot_rows remapped consistently.
- Optionally compute ncl/ncr metadata for A|B counts.
- (Optional) After mapping, sort rows by pivot then density per order.c.

Where to implement
- src/f4/mod.rs after rr/tr + closure, before elimination.
- Matrix API: src/f4/matrix.rs has reorder_columns_with_sht.

Acceptance
- Per-round logs show consistent A|B sizes; elimination times stabilize.
- Pivot reuse is effective (no stalls due to misplaced columns).

Pitfalls
- Do not pre-mark pivot rows and sort pre-mapping; sort only after mapping if needed.
notes:
Column reordering implementation exists (matrix.rs:193-259) and is optimized (uses sort_unstable_by_key), but has a correctness bug that causes test failures.

Current status: DISABLED (mod.rs:480) pending fix for ark-feanor-col-fix.

The reorder_columns_with_sht method correctly implements the A|B split (idx=2 pivots first, idx=1 reducers, then tails), but something about the interaction with the closure/reducer logic causes incorrect results. Investigation needed.

title: Benchmark + validation suite vs msolve
description:
Title: Benchmark + validation suite vs msolve

Goal
- Provide benchmarks and validation tests to compare F4 vs Buchberger and align behavior with msolve’s round semantics.

Design
- Systems: Katsura (3..6), cyclic, random dense, random sparse.
- Correctness: ideal inclusion — reduce Buchberger basis by F4 basis and vice versa (for parity targets).
- Performance: run with F4_PROFILE=0; separately run with F4_PROFILE=1 for diagnostics.
- Report: time per round, closure vs LA time proportion, number of LCM groups, rr/tr counts.

Where to implement
- examples/ (extend f4_scaling_test.rs and compare_f4_buchberger.rs), add scripts if useful.

Acceptance
- F4 matches or beats Buchberger on Katsura‑4/5/6 and larger suites; no stalls.
- Round logs show bounded closure and stable A|B mapping.

Pitfalls
- Ensure debug prints are off for timing; use env toggles to avoid skew.

title: Implement LCM-grouped minimal-degree selection
description:
Title: Implement LCM-grouped minimal-degree selection

Goal
- At each round, select S-pairs at the minimal LCM degree and group by LCM (expanded monomial). Always include the same‑LCM tail.
- If a per-round cap (mnsel) is set, cap by number of LCM groups, not by pairs. Preserve deterministic ordering.

Background
- msolve groups S-pairs by LCM within the minimal degree and processes one rr/tr per LCM group. This yields cohesive A-blocks and better reuse.

Where to implement
- src/f4/mod.rs, inside f4_configured(): after computing min_deg for the current round.

Design
- For each SPoly (i,j) with lcm_degree == min_deg:
  - Compute LCM = monomial_lcm(LT(fi), LT(fj)); expand to Vec<usize> key.
  - Insert into HashMap<Vec<usize>, LcmGroup{ lcm_mono, gens: HashSet<usize> }>.
- Selection result = ordered list of LCM groups. If mnsel is set, take the first N groups, include same-LCM tail for the Nth group.
- Preserve stable ordering (e.g., lexicographical on expanded LCM or by first appearance).

Acceptance
- Per-round logs show pivot_count equals number of LCM groups.
- rr/tr generation uses these groups in the next phase; no flat S-polynomial row construction remains.

Pitfalls
- Ensure expanded monomials use the same variable ordering as the ring.
- Be careful with caps: cap LCM groups, not pair count.
